alert.note: Alert for Los Angeles (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 15 at 6:53PM PDT by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM PDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Antelope Valley and adjacent foothill areas in eastern Los Angeles County. * WHEN...Until 845 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Water over roadways. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 648 PM PDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms have ceased. Enough rain fell to cause arroyo and small stream flooding this evening. Between 0.33 and 0.85 inch of rain were recorded in rain gauges across the advisory area. - Low water crossing may become flooded on Highway 138 between Littlerock and Llano. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Lake Los Angeles, Palmdale, Pearblossom, Llano, Littlerock, Valyermo and Highway 138 between Llano and the San Bernardino County line. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
